New Records: Matt Short reached the fastest ODI half-century by an Australian against England, achieving it in just 23 balls.
Key Match Events: Travis Head took 4-28 off 6.2 overs and scored a quickfire 31 runs.
Australia won the match by 49 runs on the DLS method.
Steve Smith managed the team excellently despite injuries and illness, leading to a series win.
Harry Brook hit six sixes off Adam Zampa and scored 72 off 52 balls.
Australia reached 1-103 in the first 10-over powerplay and 2-165 by the 20-over mark before rain intervened.
Adil Rashid scored 36 off 35 balls before being dismissed by Travis Head.
Post-Match Reflections: Mitch Marsh praised the calmness and resilience of the team despite injuries and illness.
Travis Head humorously commented on his unexpected role in death bowling.
Marsh highlighted the challenge of playing five one-dayers in 12 days and expressed pride in the team's performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was affected by rain, leading to a result determined by the DLS method.
England appeared to resort to time-wasting tactics as the 20-over mark approached.
